intro: Baeothryon hudsonianum, commonly known as the Hudson's bryony, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive, slightly lobed shape. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
